logline: A hospital room exposes the stark reality of neural augmentation as a patient undergoes cutting-edge brain surgery.
scene: Inside a sterile, dimly lit operating room, a patient lies unconscious on an advanced surgical table, wires and electrodes sprawling from a large, translucent dome encasing their head. Surrounding the table, a team of masked surgeons huddle over monitors displaying frantic streams of neural data, their faces illuminated by the glow of screens. One surgeon, holding a delicate tool that resembles a cross between a scalpel and a fiber optic cable, prepares to insert a neural lace into the patient’s brain, the tension palpable in the air as they approach the critical moment of fusion between man and machine.
keyProps: high-tech monitors with neural data displays
biofeedback interface for the surgical team
camera: a close-up of the insertion tool poised to enter the neural interface dome, with a shallow depth of field capturing the intense focus of the surgical team in the background.
lighting: soft overhead surgical lights casting a stark contrast on the patient’s face and the glowing screens, creating an ominous yet clinical atmosphere.
productionDesign: the operating room is outfitted with high-tech medical equipment and a minimalist aesthetic, featuring clean lines and a cold color palette dominated by whites and blues, emphasizing the clinical nature of advanced technology.
signatureTwist: the scene subtly hints at the ethical implications of the procedure, as a hidden camera feeds the live surgery to an underground audience, suggesting a world where personal autonomy is becoming obsolete.
avoid: any visible brand logos or texts
